sen.j: 国分寺（こくぶんじ）は、奈良県橿原市北八木2丁目にある浄土宗の寺院。
sen.e: Kokubun-ji is a Buddhist temple of Jodo Sect located in 2-chome, Kitayagi, Kashihara City Nara Prefecture.
Kokubun-ji is a Buddhist temple of Jodo Sect located in 2-chome, Kitayagi, Kashihara City Nara Prefecture.
Kokubun-ji is a Buddhist temple of Jodo Sect located in 2-chome, Kitayagi, Kashihara City Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は勝満山、別名は満法院（まんぽういん）。
sen.e: Sango is 勝満山, and another name is Manpo-in Temple.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is 勝満山, and it is also known as Manpo-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 山号の説明文を入れました。
sen.e: The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is 勝満山, and it is also known as Manpo-in Temple.

sen.j: 本尊の阿弥陀如来像及び寺宝の十一面観音立像（重要文化財）は平安時代の作品とされている（ただし、十一面観音立像は元は延命院 (橿原市)のものであったという）。
sen.e: The statue of Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), which is the principal object of worhip at this temple and the standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon, which is the treasure of this temple (designated as an important cultural property), are regarded to have been made in the Heian period (although the standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon was originally owned by Enmei-in Temple (in Kashihara City)).

The statue of Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), which is the principal object of worhip at this temple and the standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon, which is the treasure of this temple (designated as an important cultural asset), are thought to have been made in the Heian period (although the standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon was originally owned by Enmei-in Temple in Kashihara City).

The statue of Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata), which is the principal object of worhip at this temple and the standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon, which is the treasure of this temple (designated as an important cultural asset), are thought to have been made in the Heian period (although the standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon was originally owned by Enmei-in Temple in Kashihara City).

sen.j: 江戸時代には高取藩の手厚い保護を受けた。
sen.e: It had sufficient degree of protections from the Takatori domain during the Edo period.
It was fiercely defended by the Takatori domain during the Edo period.
It was fiercely defended by the Takatori domain during the Edo period.

sen.j: 宝暦11年（1761年）建立の本堂は2003年に焼失したが、重要文化財の仏像は収蔵庫に安置されていたため無事であった。
sen.e: Although the main hall, which was constructed in 1761, was burned down in 2003, the Buddhist statue, which is designated as an important cultural property, had no damage since it had been enshrined in a repository.
Although the main hall constructed in 1761 burned down in 2003, the Buddhist statue, which is designated as an important cultural asset, was undamaged since it had been installed in the storage room.
Although the main hall constructed in 1761 burned down in 2003, the Buddhist statue, which is designated as an important cultural asset, was undamaged since it had been installed in the storage room.

sen.j: 『寺田一生録』でその存在を辿れるのは天正年間までである。
sen.e: Although the origin of this temple can be traced back to Tensho era in "Terada Isshoroku", there has been a controversy over which temple should be identified as Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple listed in Engishiki, Todai-ji Temple or this temple (Kokubun-ji Temple) since this temple was identified as Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple by "Yamatoshi (Historical Records of Yamato), even though Todai-ji Temple had been commonly believed to be Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple.
The origin of this temple can be traced back to Tensho era in "Terada Isshoroku".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The origin of this temple can be traced back to Tensho era in "Terada Isshoroku".

sen.j: しかし、江戸時代に書かれた『大和志』で延喜式に記された大和国国分寺を通説であった東大寺ではなく、この寺であると比定して以後、いずれを国分寺とするかについての議論がある。
sen.e: However, there has been controversy over whether this temple or Todai-ji should be identified as Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple in the Engishiki, since this temple was identified as Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple by "Yamatoshi (Historical Records of Yamato), even though Todai-ji Temple had been commonly believed to be Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, there has been controversy over whether this temple or Todai-ji should be identified as Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple in the Engishiki, since this temple was identified as Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple by "Yamatoshi (Historical Records of Yamato), even though Todai-ji Temple had been commonly believed to be Yamato Kokubun-ji Temple.

sen.j: 実際に国分寺及びその周辺において古代に遡ることが可能な古瓦が出土されることや古代寺院の礎石と思われる石が残存していることから、全く根拠がない説とは言い難いが、今後の考古学的調査が必要とされるところである。
sen.e: It is hard to say that the theory is groundless because in fact, old roof-tiles which could be traced back to ancient times were unearthed, and a stone which seems to be a foundation stone of ancient temple remains in and around Kokubun-ji Temple, so further archaeological investigations would be necessary.

It is hard to say that the theory is groundless because in and around Kokubun-ji Temple old roof-tiles which can be traced back to ancient times were unearthed, and a stone which seems to be a foundation stone of ancient temple remains, thus further archaeological investigations are necessary.

It is hard to say that the theory is groundless because in and around Kokubun-ji Temple old roof-tiles which can be traced back to ancient times were unearthed, and a stone which seems to be a foundation stone of ancient temple remains, thus further archaeological investigations are necessary.

tit.cmt: 他のファイルに合わせました。

sen.e: Important cultural property

sen.cmt: 他のファイルに合わせました。

sen.j: 木造十一面観音立像 - 平安時代。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon - Heian period.
Wooden standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon - Heian period.
Wooden standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon - Heian period.

sen.j: 一般には公開されていない。
sen.e: It is not open to the public.
This is not usually open to the public.
sen.cmt: Thisを挿入し、一般にはをusuallyに翻訳しました。
sen.e: This is not usually open to the public.
